title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
description: The epic journey of Odysseus as he tries to return home after the Trojan War.

title: The Iliad
author: Homer
description: Set during the Trojan War, the ten-year siege of the city of Troy.

title: The Republic
author: Plato
description: A Socratic dialogue concerning justice and the order of the city-state.

title: Meditations
author: Marcus Aurelius
description: Personal writings by the Roman Emperor on Stoic philosophy.

title: No Longer Human
author: Osamu Dazai
description: A poignant novel about a man who feels incapable of understanding human beings.

title: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
description: In a future North America, teens fight to the death on live TV.

author: George Orwell
description: A chilling prophecy about the future of automated bureaucracy.

title: Inferno
author: Dan Brown
description: Robert Langdon wakes up in a hospital in Florence with no memory of the last 36 hours.

title: Meditations (New Edition)
author: Marcus Aurelius
description: A modern translation of the Stoic classic.

title: Plato: Complete Works
author: Plato
description: The collected dialogues of the ancient Greek philosopher.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A mental anguish and moral dilemmas of an impoverished ex-student.

title: Catching Fire
author: Suzanne Collins
description: The second book in the Hunger Games trilogy.

title: Animal Farm
author: George Orwell
description: A satirical allegorical novella reflecting on the Russian Revolution.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
description: A murder in the Louvre reveals a sinister plot.

title: The Symposium
author: Plato
description: A philosophical text by Plato concerning the genesis, purpose and nature of love.

title: The Aeneid
author: Virgil
description: The legendary story of Aeneas, a Trojan who travelled to Italy.

title: Metamorphosis
author: Franz Kafka
description: Gregor Samsa wakes up one morning to find himself transformed into a giant insect.

title: Mockingjay
author: Suzanne Collins
description: The final book in the Hunger Games trilogy.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A futuristic society where citizens are genetically bred and socially indoctrinated.

title: Angels & Demons
author: Dan Brown
description: Robert Langdon is called to a Swiss research facility to analyze a mysterious symbol.

title: Greek Mythology
author: Edith Hamilton
description: Timeless tales of gods and heroes.

title: Beyond Good and Evil
author: Friedrich Nietzsche
description: Nietzsche accuses past philosophers of lacking critical sense and blindly accepting dogmatic premises.

title: Letters from a Stoic
author: Seneca
description: timeless wisdom on how to live a good life.

title: The Stranger
author: Albert Camus
description: An ordinary man is unwittingly drawn into a senseless murder.

title: Divergent
author: Veronica Roth
description: In a world divided by factions based on virtues, Tris learns she's Divergent.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: A future American society where books are outlawed and 'firemen' burn any that are found.

title: The Lost Symbol
author: Dan Brown
description: A master of the hidden history and symbols of Washington, D.C.

title: Apology
author: Plato
description: Plato's version of the speech given by Socrates as he defended himself in 399 BC.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: Broadly focuses on Napoleon's invasion of Russia in 1812.

title: Thus Spoke Zarathustra
author: Friedrich Nietzsche
description: A philosophical novel by German philosopher Friedrich Nietzsche.

title: The Setting Sun
author: Osamu Dazai
description: A novel about the decline of an aristocratic family in post-war Japan.

title: Insurgent
author: Veronica Roth
description: Tris Prior must continue to save those she loves.

title: Lord of the Flies
author: William Golding
description: A group of British boys stranded on an uninhabited island.

title: Deception Point
author: Dan Brown
description: A shocking scientific discovery in the Arctic Ocean.

title: Phaedo
author: Plato
description: Depicts the death of Socrates.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A passionate philosophical novel that enters deeply into the ethical debates of God, free will, and morality.

title: Nicomachean Ethics
author: Aristotle
description: Aristotle's most important work on ethics.

title: Norwegian Wood
author: Haruki Murakami
description: A nostalgic story of loss and burgeoning sexuality.

title: Maze Runner
author: James Dashner
description: Thomas wakes up in a lift with no memory, only to find himself in a maze.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
description: Set in a near-future New England, in a totalitarian state.

title: Digital Fortress
author: Dan Brown
description: The NSA's invincible code-breaking machine encounters a mysterious code.

title: Critique of Pure Reason
author: Immanuel Kant
description: Investigating the limits and scope of human metaphysics.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel of manners.

title: Tao Te Ching
author: Lao Tzu
description: A fundamental text for both philosophical and religious Taoism.

title: Kafka on the Shore
author: Haruki Murakami
description: A metaphysical novel with cats that talk and fish that fall from the sky.

title: The Giver
author: Lois Lowry
description: Jonas lives in a seemingly ideal, if colorless, world of conformity and contentment.

title: A Clockwork Orange
author: Anthony Burgess
description: Set in a near-future society that has a youth subculture of extreme violence.

title: Origin
author: Dan Brown
description: Langdon navigates a trail of clues to unlock a scientific breakthrough.

title: Euthyphro
author: Plato
description: A dialogue by Plato, in which Socrates and Euthyphro discuss the nature of piety.

title: Great Expectations

description: The story of the orphan Pip.

title: The Art of War

description: An ancient Chinese military treatise dating from the Late Spring and Autumn Period.

title: 1Q84
author: Haruki Murakami
description: A story of how a woman enters a parallel existence.

title: Ready Player One

description: A dystopian science fiction novel set in the year 2045.

title: Slaughterhouse-Five

description: An anti-war novel centered on the firebombing of Dresden.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
author: Stieg Larsson
description: Disappearance of a wealthy patriarch's niece.

title: Discourse on Method
author: René Descartes
description: I think, therefore I am.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
description: The experiences of its eponymous heroine, including her growth to adulthood.

title: Being and Time
author: Martin Heidegger
description: One of the most significant texts of 20th-century Continental philosophy.

title: Beloved
author: Toni Morrison
description: Set after the American Civil War, it tells the story of a family of former slaves.

title: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
description: A post-apocalyptic tale of a journey of a father and his young son.

title: Atlas Shrugged
author: Ayn Rand
description: Depicts a dystopian United States where private businesses suffer under increasingly burdensome laws.

title: Gone Girl
author: Gillian Flynn
description: A thriller that unearths the secrets at the heart of a modern marriage.

title: Leviathan
author: Thomas Hobbes
description: Concerns the structure of society and legitimate government.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
description: A tale of passion and revenge on the Yorkshire moors.

title: Ethics

description: A philosophical treatise written in Latin.

title: The Catcher in the Rye

description: A story about teenage angst and alienation.

title: Neuromancer

description: One of the earliest and best-known works in the cyberpunk genre.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: Set on the desert planet Arrakis.

title: The Silence of the Lambs
author: Thomas Harris
description: A young FBI trainee must confide in an incarcerated and manipulative killer.

title: Confessions
author: Saint Augustine
description: An autobiographical work, consisting of 13 books.

title: Moby Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: The narrative of the sailor Ishmael and the obsession of Captain Ahab.

title: Simulacra and Simulation

title: The Martian

description: An astronaut becomes stranded on Mars after his team assumes him dead.

title: Big Little Lies

description: A murder mystery set in a tranquil beachfront town.

title: Summa Theologica
author: Thomas Aquinas
description: The best-known work of Thomas Aquinas.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: Tells the story of Victor Frankenstein, a young scientist who creates a sapient creature.

title: Candide
author: Voltaire
description: A French satire first published in 1759.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality.
